author: sussman
msg: Fixups/improvements/suggestions from gstein, regarding recent 'svn
merge' work.  Thanks!
* log.c (log_do_merge): if we do the merge in a subpool, it makes
sense to construct the path arguments in that subpool too.
* repos_diff.c (struct file_baton):  oops, we want the parent_baton
field completely removed, not just temporarily commented out.
(make_dir_baton, make_file_baton): simplify by taking a full path,
not a basename or parent path.  no need to take an edit baton
either, if parent baton already has it.
[when converting the editor, I was trying to make the smallest
change possible, but greg is right -- the original interfaces
are now crufty.  :-) ]
(open_root): build an initial dir_baton using "".
(delete_entry, add_file, open_file): simplify call to make_file_baton.
(add_directory, open_directory):  simplify call to make_dir_baton.

author: sussman
msg: Have 'svn merge' use a genuine trace editor.
* diff.c (diff_or_merge):  if an after-editor was passed in, compose
it with the diff editor.
(merge_cmd):  stop dumping printfs.

author: sussman
msg: Convert the repository-diff editor to the new editor interface;  part
of work on 'svn merge'.
* libsvn_client/client.h (svn_client__get_diff_editor):  change
prototype to return svn_delta_editor_t.
* libsvn_client/repos_diff.c (svn_client__get_diff_editor): return
new-style editor.
(struct file_baton):  remove pointer to parent dir_baton.  in the
new system, we need to account for the fact that file batons might
outlive their parent dir batons.  use a (const char *) for internal
path.
(struct dir_baton):  use const char * for internal path.
(make_dir_baton): take a const char *path. allocate dir_baton
directly in the pool passed in.  the dir_baton remembers the pool
it's allocated in.
(make_file_baton): take a pool and edit_baton argument.  no longer
take a parent baton, but just a const char *path instead.  allocate
the file_baton directly in the passed-in pool, and remember it.
(open_root): take a pool arg, allocate dir baton in that pool.
(delete_entry): take a pool arg.  use this pool to perform the
deletion callback, and trust the driver to free it.  no more
basename passed in, but a full relative path.
(add_directory, open_directory, add_file, open_file): take a pool
arg, and take a path relative to the editor's anchor instead of a
basename.  allocate the baton in this pool.
(close_directory): removed, no longer needed.  we're trusting the
driver to destroy the pool the dir_baton is allocated in, so the
default no-op function is sufficient.
(close_file):  no need to free the file_baton, driver will do so.
(run_diff_cmd): comment the callback args
* libsvn_client/diff.c (diff_or_merge): temporarily wrap the editor so
that it appears to be "old" style, so that it can still be used by
our unconverted drivers.
* notes/editor-conversion.txt:  mark this editor conversion DONE.

author: bcollins
msg: * libsvn_client/ra.c:
(svn_client__open_ra_session): Set get_wc_prop callback to NULL if
!use_admin. This was preventing imports.

author: rooneg
msg: * packages/freebsd/subversion/Makefile
just use the PORTVERSION variable when defining WRKSRC, rather than
hardcoding the same value in two places.
Pointed out by: gstein
